entry.title: Honored to share that I’ve been selected as a 2024 NSF Fellow!

link.title: Honored to share that I’ve been selected as a 2024 NSF Fellow!

entry.content: I’m honored to share that I’ve been selected as an National Science Foundation (NSF) Graduate Research Fellow this year, supporting my upcoming PhD studies at Princeton this fall. Excited to join the ZERO Lab and continue my journey in macro-energy systems research!
entry.summary: I’m honored to share that I’ve been selected as an National Science Foundation (NSF) Graduate Research Fellow this year, supporting my upcoming PhD studies at Princeton this fall. Excited to join the ZERO Lab and continue my journey in macro-energy systems research!

entry.title: Thank you to BrightNight for a wonderful gap year opportunity

link.title: Thank you to BrightNight for a wonderful gap year opportunity

entry.content:
I’d like to thank my team members on the Energy Analytics team at Brightnight for providing me a wonderful opportunity to work in industry during my gap year. Thank you Amir, Danielle, Mohit, Nonso, Venkat, and everyone else I collaborated with at BrightNight!

The Brightnight team at the groundbreaking for the Box Canyon Solar Project, a 300-megawatt solar power plant in Pinal County, Arizona
entry.summary: I’d like to thank my team members on the Energy Analytics team at Brightnight for providing me a wonderful opportunity to work in industry during my gap year. Thank you Amir, Danielle, Mohit, Nonso, Venkat, and everyone else I collaborated with at BrightNight!

entry.title: Graduation and Gap Year Plans
entry.content:
I’m happy to share that I’ve recently defended my senior thesis and graduated from Caltech with a B.S. in Engineering and Applied Sciences!

A year from now, I look forward to starting my PhD at Princeton University, joining Prof. Jesse Jenkins and the ZERO Lab to conduct energy systems research, with the goal of informing energy and climate policy. During my gap year, I am excited to join BrightNight to develop industry-leading renewable power solutions as part of the Energy Analytics team.

I’m immensely grateful for the mentorship of Ken Caldeira, Nate Lewis, Jackie Dowling, Edgar Virgüez, and many more. Thank you to everyone who guided me throughout my undergraduate journey!
entry.summary: I’m happy to share that I’ve recently defended my senior thesis and graduated from Caltech with a B.S. in Engineering and Applied Sciences!
